description: In this series we’ll talk about each faction, what they have to offer, how they play, and talk about a few list concepts to consider. You can find all the Faction Focuses that we’ve published here. We’re almost a year into tenth edition and Chaos Knights have been ever present on tables since the beginning even […]
title: 10th Edition Competitive Faction Focus: Chaos Knights

description: We’re gearing up our coverage of First World War wargames in the Goonhammer Historicals Star Fort, whether that’s discussing why it’s a less popular war to game, looking at Weird War One, and the first of the plastic kits from Wargames Atlantic – the 1916-1940 French. It’s turned out not to be such a long […]
title: Goonhammer Historicals: Wargames Atlantic WW1 British Review

description: The modern version of Necromunda turns seven this year — pretty darn old, in Goliath years. The game is now pretty mature: there are scores of rulebooks, White Dwarf supplements and Apocryphas. It all adds up to a lot of content. As we await the next expansion, the Necromunday team got together to discuss the […]
title: The State of Necromunda: A Round-Table Discussion

description: This week’s Hammer of Math takes a look at some of the probabilities behind the core rules of Para Bellum’s Conquest: The Last Argument of Kings. One of the nice things about writing for a game website is that it gives me an opportunity to be exposed to a variety of games and experiences. Often […]
title: Hammer of Math: Probabilities in Conquest

description: What We Learned – The Models What a nice model, and another replacement for a model that was stricken as part of the retirements. Trading a flight stand for a not flight stand is always good in my book and the upsweep of the wings appears to more forgiving for those who actually push models […]
title: Age of Sigmar Fourth Edition Explained – May 6th

description: John from Can You Roll a Crit? is back with his own review of the Darktide Board Game! He covers this hex-based box based on the Kill Team rules, covering how well it translates as a board game plus how it works as a semi-gateway into Kill Team itself!
title: CYRAC: Darktide Board Game Review

description: 2023 ITC Champion Adrian Bonvento Joins Jason and Travis to talk about what he’s been doing since the Las Vegas Open secured him the big win. He’s left his Kommandos behind to play Corsair Voidscarred instead. We’ve also got JAKTP’s review of the Darktide box set as well (link)! Brooklyn Strategist, Adrian’s Home Shop: https://www.instagram.com/thebrooklynstrategist/ […]
title: JAKTP Episode 64: Deep Dive on Corsair Voidscarred with 2023’s #1 Adrian Bonvento
